query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 O voi che siete in piccioletta barca, 2 desiderosi d’ascoltar, seguiti 3 dietro al mio legno che cantando varca,
query.error: **English:** 1 O you who are in a tiny boat, 2 eager to listen, follow 3 behind my ship that sails singing,
query.result: 1 O wheth a's teves y'n avon vyghan, 2 awesyer dhe'n klevvos, sewgh, 3 wosa'm avon a wra kanna yn kanna,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 tornate a riveder li vostri liti: 5 non vi mettete in pelago, ché forse, 6 perdendo me, rimarreste smarriti.
query.error: **English:** 4 turn back to see your shores again: 5 do not put out to sea, for perhaps, 6 losing me, you would remain lost.
query.result: 4 drok dhe weles dha'gas tir: 5 na wra'gas dhe'n mor, rag mar, 6 mar kollaf vy, whethsa kollet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 L’acqua ch’io prendo già mai non si corse; 8 Minerva spira, e conducemi Appollo, 9 e nove Muse mi dimostran l’Orse.
query.error: **English:** 7 The waters that I take have never been sailed before; 8 Minerva breathes, and Apollo guides me, 9 and the nine Muses show me the Great Bear.
query.result: 7 An dowr a wra'm bys vyth na wra fordhys, 8 Minerva a wra'n anaval, ha'm Apollo a wra'm ledyer, 9 ha'n naw Musedh a wra'm diskwedhes an Arth Mawr.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Voialtri pochi che drizzaste il collo 11 per tempo al pan de li angeli, del quale 12 vivesi qui ma non sen vien satollo,
query.error: **English:** 10 You few who turned your necks 11 early to the bread of the angels, on which 12 one lives here but is never satisfied,
query.result: 10 Wheth vy nebes a wra'gas droes dha'gas kolon 11 a-termyn dhe'n bara a'n eleth, neb a wra'gas 12 ow byw y'n-ma mes na wra'gas seth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 metter potete ben per l’alto sale 14 vostro navigio, servando mio solco 15 dinanzi a l’acqua che ritorna equale.
query.error: **English:** 13 you may indeed set your ship 14 on the high seas, following my furrow 15 ahead of the water that returns to its level.
query.result: 13 whethsa gallos gorra'gas dha'gas avon 14 warbarth dhe'm solk, ow servya'm fordh 15 rag an dowr a wra'n dro dhe'n keth lefel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Que’ glorïosi che passaro al Colco 17 non s’ammiraron come voi farete, 18 quando Iasón vider fatto bifolco.
query.error: **English:** 16 Those glorious ones who sailed to Colchis 17 did not marvel as you will do, 18 when they saw Jason turned plowman.
query.result: 16 An re beu lowenek a wra'gas dhe'n Colchis 17 na wra'gas kemmys ow thowgh whethsa wra'gas gwul, 18 pan welas Iasón ow tos ha bosvelyer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 La concreata e perpetüa sete 20 del deïforme regno cen portava 21 veloci quasi come ’l ciel vedete.
query.error: **English:** 19 The concrete and perpetual thirst 20 of the deformed realm carried us 21 swift as you see the sky.
query.result: 19 An syth ha bos ha byth 20 a'n rynos diffrys a'n porthas 21 kyns fast avel an nef a welas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Beatrice in suso, e io in lei guardava; 23 e forse in tanto in quanto un quadrel posa 24 e vola e da la noce si dischiava,
query.error: **English:** 22 Beatrice above, and I gazed up at her; 23 and perhaps in the time that an arrow rests 24 and flies and frees itself from the bowstring,
query.result: 22 Beatrice a-ugh, ha my a welas 23 ha mar pleg tramorr saeth a-hedh 24 ha'y tevi ha'gas ow nawdhogeth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 giunto mi vidi ove mirabil cosa 26 mi torse il viso a sé; e però quella 27 cui non potea mia cura essere ascosa,
query.error: **English:** 25 I saw myself arrived where a wondrous thing 26 turned my face toward it; and therefore she 27 to whom my thoughts could not be hidden,
query.result: 25 my a welas ow tos ha le mayn 26 a droe'm fas dheworth; ha dre henna 27 henna na alla'm ow tos ow fenowgh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 volta ver’ me, sì lieta come bella, 29 «Drizza la mente in Dio grata», mi disse, 30 «che n’ha congiunti con la prima stella».
query.error: **English:** 28 turned to me, as joyful as she was beautiful, 29 and said, "Direct your mind gratefully to God, 30 who has joined us with the first star."
query.result: 28 a droe dhyworth, kyns lowen a wel, 29 "Gwra dha'n menydh dhe'n Duw yn fast", hi a leveris, 30 "a'n gwreugh ni keffrys gans an kynsa steren".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Parev’ a me che nube ne coprisse 32 lucida, spessa, solida e pulita, 33 quasi adamante che lo sol ferisse.
query.error: **English:** 31 It seemed to me that a cloud covered us, 32 bright, dense, solid, and polished, 33 like a diamond struck by the sun.
query.result: 31 Ythollen dhym ow tos kov a'n gwreugh 32 skler, tewl, kalet ha glan, 33 kepar dyamant a dhevedh an howl.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Per entro sé l’etterna margarita 35 ne ricevette, com’ acqua recepe 36 raggio di luce permanendo unita.
query.error: **English:** 34 Within itself the eternal pearl 35 received us, as water receives 36 a ray of light, remaining united.
query.result: 34 Yn-mes y honan an margarit byth 35 a'n resevis, kepar dowr a resev 36 gweliow golon ow pos dhemedhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 S’io era corpo, e qui non si concepe 38 com’ una dimensione altra patio, 39 ch’esser convien se corpo in corpo repe,
query.error: **English:** 37 If I was a body, and here it is not understood 38 how one dimension can enter another, 39 which must be the case if a body enters a body,
query.result: 37 Mar ow kow korf, ha hemma na wra gesys 38 kepar on dimensiyon aral a alla'n, 39 ow res dhemedhys mar korf yn korf a wra,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 accender ne dovria più il disio 41 di veder quella essenza in che si vede 42 come nostra natura e Dio s’unio.
query.error: **English:** 40 it should kindle in us a greater desire 41 to see that essence in which it is seen 42 how our nature and God were united.
query.result: 40 yth alla'n dhe'n ni moy an desyr 41 dhe weles henna essens yn-mes yma 42 kepar an natur dha ni ha Duw a unys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Lì si vedrà ciò che tenem per fede, 44 non dimostrato, ma fia per sé noto 45 a guisa del ver primo che l’uom crede.
query.error: **English:** 43 There shall be seen what we hold by faith, 44 not demonstrated, but will be known in itself 45 like the first truth that man believes.
query.result: 43 Eno ythollen ni henna tramorr fydh, 44 heb dhe'n provia, mes ythollen dhemedhys 45 kepar an gwir kynsa a grys an den.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Io rispuosi: «Madonna, sì devoto 47 com’ esser posso più, ringrazio lui 48 lo qual dal mortal mondo m’ha remoto.
query.error: **English:** 46 I answered: "My Lady, as devoutly 47 as I can be, I thank him 48 who has removed me from the mortal world.
query.result: 46 My a leveris: "Madon, kyns devos 47 avellam ow pos, my a res deriv 48 henna a'm removis ow'm an bys marow".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Ma ditemi: che son li segni bui 50 di questo corpo, che là giuso in terra 51 fan di Cain favoleggiare altrui?».
query.error: **English:** 49 But tell me: what are the dark signs 50 of this body, which down there on earth 51 make people tell tales of Cain?
query.result: 49 Mes leveris dhym: pyw yw an arwodhow tywyll 50 a'n korf ma, owth allá yn-nans yn-nans 51 a wra tusow gwreydhyow a-dro dhe Geyn?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Ella sorrise alquanto, e poi «S’elli erra 53 l’oppinïon», mi disse, «d’i mortali 54 dove chiave di senso non diserra,
query.error: **English:** 52 She smiled a little, and then said to me, "If the opinion 53 of mortals errs, 54 where the key of understanding does not unlock,
query.result: 52 Hi a'm smialis bythyn, ha wosa "Mar erra 53 oppinion", hi a leveris dhym, "an dusow 54 le mayn na wra aghel a sens na wra agor,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 certo non ti dovrien punger li strali 56 d’ammirazione omai, poi dietro ai sensi 57 vedi che la ragione ha corte l’ali.
query.error: **English:** 55 certainly the arrows 56 of wonder should no longer pierce you, since behind the senses 57 you see that reason has clipped its wings.
query.result: 55 sur, na dhrehedh dhe'n ni an strali 56 a admiraysyon bythyn, wosa wosa wosa 57 gweles ti ow reson a'n gorth y'i eselyow".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Ma dimmi quel che tu da te ne pensi». 59 E io: «Ciò che n’appar qua sù diverso 60 credo che fanno i corpi rari e densi».
query.error: **English:** 58 But tell me what you think of it yourself." 59 And I: "That which appears different up here 60 I believe is caused by the bodies being rare and dense."
query.result: 58 Mes dywedh vy dheugh pyth a wra vyth pens. 59 Ha my: "An pyth a wra'n dyskwedhys yma a-ugh 60 a grysaf vyth gwres an corfow rari ha dens."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Ed ella: «Certo assai vedrai sommerso 62 nel falso il creder tuo, se bene ascolti 63 l’argomentar ch’io li farò avverso.
query.error: **English:** 61 And she: "You will certainly see your belief submerged 62 in falsehood, if you listen well 63 to the argument that I will make against it.
query.result: 61 Ha hi: "Yn sur, ty a welo dy gredens ow somersi 62 yn fals, mar klevs bythyn 63 an argumens owth y'm gwruthyl yn erbyn."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 La spera ottava vi dimostra molti 65 lumi, li quali e nel quale e nel quanto 66 notar si posson di diversi volti.
query.error: **English:** 64 The eighth sphere shows you many 65 lights, which can be noted in their quality and quantity 66 with different aspects.
query.result: 64 An eghves spyr a dhiskwedh dhisogh 65 golow, an re beu gans an pals 66 a yll bos merkys gans gwriansow dyffrans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Se raro e denso ciò facesser tanto, 68 una sola virtù sarebbe in tutti, 69 più e men distributa e altrettanto.
query.error: **English:** 67 If rarity and density made this so much, 68 there would be only one virtue in all things, 69 distributed more or less, but equally.
query.result: 67 Mar raritedh ha denstedh a wra gwruthyl hemma kemmys, 68 unn virtudes bythyn a vydh yn pub tra, 69 dystribuys moy ha le, mes ughel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Virtù diverse esser convegnon frutti 71 di princìpi formali, e quei, for ch’uno, 72 seguiterieno a tua ragion distrutti.
query.error: **English:** 70 Diverse virtues must be the fruits 71 of formal principles, and those, because they are one, 72 would follow your reasoning to be destroyed.
query.result: 70 Virtues dyffrans a wra dhe bythyn frooth 71 a brynsip formal, ha hemma, rag wosa unn, 72 a vydh sewys dhe'th reson dhestruys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Ancor, se raro fosse di quel bruno 74 cagion che tu dimandi, o d’oltre in parte 75 fora di sua materia sì digiuno
query.error: **English:** 73 Again, if that dark color you ask about 74 were caused by rarity, or in part by something else, 75 this planet would be so devoid of its matter
query.result: 73 Estre, mar raritedh a vydh a hwegen 74 an achos an ke'th owth gorra, po dhe'th rann 75 hemma planet a vydh kemmys difudh a'y mater

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 esto pianeto, o, sì come comparte 77 lo grasso e ’l magro un corpo, così questo 78 nel suo volume cangerebbe carte.
query.error: **English:** 76 this planet, or, as 77 the fat and the lean change a body, so this 78 would change its pages in its volume.
query.result: 76 an planet ma, o, avel ma 77 an gros ha'n tanow corf, marow ma an 78 yn y volum a wra chanjya paperow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Se ’l primo fosse, fora manifesto 80 ne l’eclissi del sol, per trasparere 81 lo lume come in altro raro ingesto.
query.error: **English:** 79 If the first were the case, it would be evident 80 in the eclipses of the sun, because the light would shine through 81 as in another rare object.
query.result: 79 Mar an kynsa a vydh, hemma a vydh kler 80 yn ekl ips an howl, rag treuslusi 81 an golon kepar yn aral raritedh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Questo non è: però è da vedere 83 de l’altro; e s’elli avvien ch’io l’altro cassi, 84 falsificato fia lo tuo parere.
query.error: **English:** 82 This is not the case: therefore we must consider 83 the other; and if it happens that I disprove the other, 84 your opinion will be falsified.
query.result: 82 Hemma nyns yw: rag yma dhe weles 83 an aral; ha mar hwra hemma'm owth kassi, 84 hemma'th breder a vydh falsyfikyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 S’elli è che questo raro non trapassi, 86 esser conviene un termine da onde 87 lo suo contrario più passar non lassi;
query.error: **English:** 85 If it is the case that this rarity does not pass through, 86 there must be a limit from which 87 its opposite can pass no further;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 e indi l’altrui raggio si rifonde 89 così come color torna per vetro 90 lo qual di retro a sé piombo nasconde.
query.error: **English:** 88 and from there the other's ray is reflected 89 just as color returns through glass 90 which hides lead behind it.
query.result: 88 ha dhyworth hemma an golon aral a wra 89 owth reflekti kepar ha liw a wra owth torna dreus gwydr 90 an ke'th owth kudha plomm y'n y gila.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Or dirai tu ch’el si dimostra tetro 92 ivi lo raggio più che in altre parti, 93 per esser lì refratto più a retro.
query.error: **English:** 91 Now you will say that the ray appears darker there 92 than in other parts, 93 because it is refracted more backward there.
query.result: 91 Mes lemmyn ty a leverel henna hemma a wra 92 owth diskwedhes tetter ena y'n rann aral, 93 rag bythyn refrektys moy y'n y gila.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Da questa instanza può deliberarti 95 esperïenza, se già mai la provi, 96 ch’esser suol fonte ai rivi di vostr’ arti.
query.error: **English:** 94 Experience can free you from this objection, 95 if you ever try it, 96 which is usually the source of the streams of your arts.
query.result: 94 A hemma istans hemma a yll dhe livra 95 eksperians, mar byth ty a'y provia, 96 an ke'th a wra suol fenten dhe'n reverow a'th artow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Tre specchi prenderai; e i due rimovi 98 da te d’un modo, e l’altro, più rimosso, 99 tr’ambo li primi li occhi tuoi ritrovi.
query.error: **English:** 97 Three mirrors you will take; and the two remove 98 from you in one way, and the other, more removed, 99 between the first two your eyes you will find.
query.result: 97 Tri drygh a wra vy kemer; ha'n dhew a remov 98 dhyworthos yn unn fordh, ha'n arall, moy remov, 99 ynter an dhew gynsa vy'n golwg a gav.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Rivolto ad essi, fa che dopo il dosso 101 ti stea un lume che i tre specchi accenda 102 e torni a te da tutti ripercosso.
query.error: **English:** 100 Turned towards them, make sure that behind your back 101 there is a light that lights up the three mirrors 102 and returns to you reflected from all of them.
query.result: 100 Drehevys dheugh, gwrewdh wosa'n dhreus 101 bos unn golon gans tre drygh a endev 102 ha'n dro dheugh a-dhyworth pub onan re berthev.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Ben che nel quanto tanto non si stenda 104 la vista più lontana, lì vedrai 105 come convien ch’igualmente risplenda.
query.error: **English:** 103 Although the furthest sight does not extend 104 so far, there you will see 105 how it is right that I should shine there.
query.result: 103 Erbynn na'n pell na'n moyha na strendya 104 an golwg moyha, ena yth gwely 105 pyth yw dhevedhek wosa'n splandya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Or, come ai colpi de li caldi rai 107 de la neve riman nudo il suggetto 108 e dal colore e dal freddo primai,
query.error: **English:** 106 Now, just as under the blows of the warm rays 107 of the sun the subject remains bare 108 of colour and of the cold it had before,
query.result: 106 Mes, kepar dhe'n tasow a'n gwrelow tomm 107 a'n ergh yw hedhes nans an danvon 108 a'n liw ha'n yen a-dhyworth kyns,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 così rimaso te ne l’intelletto 110 voglio informar di luce sì vivace, 111 che ti tremolerà nel suo aspetto.
query.error: **English:** 109 so, having remained in your intellect, 110 I want to inform you with such a lively light, 111 that it will make you tremble in its aspect.
query.result: 109 kepar henna re beu yn de'thvos, 110 y'th wra vy formya gans golon kemmys byw, 111 hag a wra'th teveles yn y'n golwg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Dentro dal ciel de la divina pace 113 si gira un corpo ne la cui virtute 114 l’esser di tutto suo contento giace.
query.error: **English:** 112 Within the heaven of divine peace 113 a body revolves in whose virtue 114 the being of all its content lies.
query.result: 112 Yn mes an nef a'n peash dyvynek 113 y troyl korf yn y gallu 114 mayth yss bos oll y lowena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Lo ciel seguente, c’ha tante vedute, 116 quell’ esser parte per diverse essenze, 117 da lui distratte e da lui contenute.
query.error: **English:** 115 The following heaven, which has so many stars, 116 that being divides through diverse essences, 117 by it separated and by it contained.
query.result: 115 An nef nessa, gans lies vydhyn, 116 an boos henna a rann dre lies essens, 117 gans an nef digemeras ha gans an nef keverys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Li altri giron per varie differenze 119 le distinzion che dentro da sé hanno 120 dispongono a lor fini e lor semenze.
query.error: **English:** 118 The other spheres, through various differences, 119 the distinctions which they have within themselves 120 arrange for their ends and their seeds.
query.result: 118 An erel giron dre lies dyffriansow, 119 an dyffriansow ena yns y honan, 120 a wra'n dyffriansow ha'n honan ha'n hadrow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Questi organi del mondo così vanno, 122 come tu vedi omai, di grado in grado, 123 che di sù prendono e di sotto fanno.
query.error: **English:** 121 These organs of the world thus proceed, 122 as you now see, from grade to grade, 123 that from above they receive and below they act.
query.result: 121 An organow ma'n bys a wra'n gwell, 122 dell wely byth ow tos, a renk a renk, 123 ow kemer a uch ha gwreugh a iseul.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Riguarda bene omai sì com’ io vado 125 per questo loco al vero che disiri, 126 sì che poi sappi sol tener lo guado.
query.error: **English:** 124 Now look well how I proceed 125 through this place to the truth that you desire, 126 so that afterwards you may know how to keep the ford alone.
query.result: 124 Gwel yn ta byth ow tos, 125 dre'n le ma'n bys dhe'n gwir henna a wynnys, 126 rag henna wosa henna yth wra gows an fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Lo moto e la virtù d’i santi giri, 128 come dal fabbro l’arte del martello, 129 da’ beati motor convien che spiri;
query.error: **English:** 127 The motion and the order of the holy spheres, 128 as the art of the hammer from the blacksmith, 129 must come from blessed movers;
query.result: 127 An lus ha'n urdh an meneth gwyn, 128 mar dhe'n gow an golgh dhe'n mynor, 129 dhe'n spyrys beudh dhe'n lowenoryon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 e ’l ciel cui tanti lumi fanno bello, 131 de la mente profonda che lui volve 132 prende l’image e fassene suggello.
query.error: **English:** 130 And the heaven which so many lights make beautiful, 131 from the profound mind that revolves it 132 takes the image and makes of it a seal.
query.result: 130 Ha'n nef a wra dhe'n sterennow gwyn, 131 a'n menes dowr a wra'n tro'y, 132 a wra'n an sketh ha'n sel a'y honan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 E come l’alma dentro a vostra polve 134 per differenti membra e conformate 135 a diverse potenze si risolve,
query.error: **English:** 133 And as the soul within your body 134 through different and conforming limbs 135 resolves itself into diverse powers,
query.result: 133 Ha kevel an eneval yn aga korf 134 a-dreusva aga esel ha kesunyes 135 dhe aga gallosow dyffrans,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 così l’intelligenza sua bontate 137 multiplicata per le stelle spiega, 138 girando sé sovra sua unitate.
query.error: **English:** 136 so its goodness, its intelligence 137 multiplies itself and unfolds through the stars, 138 revolving around its own unity.
query.result: 136 kevel hy boos, aga splannder 137 a wra dhester an sterennow, 138 ow kul ow-hunan warbarth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Virtù diversa fa diversa lega 140 col prezïoso corpo ch’ella avviva, 141 nel qual, sì come vita in voi, si lega.
query.error: **English:** 139 Diverse virtue makes a diverse alloy 140 with the precious body that it enlivens, 141 in which, just as life is bound up in you, it is bound.
query.result: 139 Gallosow dyffrans a wra kesunyans dyffrans 140 gans an korf prysek a wra hi ow bevya, 141 yn aga, kevel an byw ynwi, hi a wra kesunyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Per la natura lieta onde deriva, 143 la virtù mista per lo corpo luce 144 come letizia per pupilla viva.
query.error: **English:** 142 Because of the joyful nature from which it derives, 143 the virtue mingled through the body shines 144 like joy through a living pupil.
query.result: 142 Dre an naturel lowen a-dhyworth, 143 an gallosow kemyskys a-dreus an korf a wra skler, 144 kevel lowender a-dreus pupul byw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Da essa vien ciò che da luce a luce 146 par differente, non da denso e raro; 147 essa è formal principio che produce,
query.error: **English:** 145 From it comes that which gives light to light, 146 apparently different, not from dense and rare; 147 it is the formal principle that produces,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
148 conforme a sua bontà, lo turbo e ’l chiaro».
query.error: **English:** 148 in accordance with its goodness, the dark and the bright.
query.result: 148 herwydh aga boos, an tywyllder ha’n sklerder.
